data.title: Steven McGuire on LinkedIn: One of the highlights of my China trip was the alumni evening in Shanghai.
data.meta_description: One of the highlights of my China trip was the alumni evening in Shanghai.
data.text:
Another big milestone for Impact Consulting! ü•Ç We are on the hunt for a Head of University Partnerships! The ideal candidate will have strong experience in #careers / #business #engagement / #employability within the #HE sector. üéì If this is you ‚òù plus you're looking for a change then drop me a message or apply directly below Not right for you? How about someone in your network?

Today, the University of East Anglia had the pleasure of welcoming the Egyptian Cultural Attach√©, Dr. Rasha. The visit marked a significant step in strengthening UEA‚Äôs ties with the Egyptian Cultural and Education Bureau. During the visit, Professor David, Vice Chancellor and President, signed an agreement with Dr.Rasha in the presence of Professor Steven, Pro-vice chancellor International. The visit was a resounding success, fostering mutual understanding and exploring ways of collaboration. The visit was planned to showcase the university's academic excellence, the incredible facilities at UEA, and to discuss potential engagements in Egypt. In addition to, Dr.Rasha had successful meetings with Dr. Stephen Laycock, Associate Dean of Admissions-Science Faculty, Dr.Stefano Landini, Director of Internationalisation Engineering School, Dr.Rudy Lapeer, Deputy Head of Computing School, and Emma Payne, Associate Director-INTO UEA. Steven McGuire Stephen Laycock Stefano Landini Rasha ElShiekh Emma Payne UEA School of Engineering #UEA #University_of_East_Anglia #Egypt #StudyUK #UKHE

What a glorious new affirmation! ‚ÄúBe in no doubt: international students are welcome in the UK. This new government values their contribution ‚Äì to our universities, to our communities, to our country,‚Äù said UK Secretary of State for Education Bridget Phillipson in a speech today at the ‚ÄòEmbassy Network Conference. ‚ÄúFor too long international students have been treated as political footballs, not valued guests‚Ä¶ Their fees welcomed, but their presence resented. Exploited for cheap headlines, not cherished for all they bring to our communities. ‚ÄúThis government will take a different approach and we will speak clearly.‚Äù This is a wonderful and welcome shift in rhetoric from the new The Labour Party government in the UK. AND there‚Äôs a clear statement on visa-study work visas: ‚ÄúWe will do everything we can to help [international students] succeed, she said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why we offer the opportunity to remain in the UK on a graduate visa for two years after their studies end ‚Äì or threefor PhDs ‚Äì to work, to live, and to contribute.‚Äù Read the full speech here: https://lnkd.in/eXwDwVHC #studyabroad #intled #studyUK #weareinternational Universities UK International
